fi.karilaalo.trin.reqTokenAuth

Class UserInfoController

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.karilaalo.trin.reqTokenAuth.UserInfoController

  • @Controller
public class UserInfoController
extends Object
    The controller class for the application to display user information conveyed by the authenticative proxy on front of the application.

      • getInfo

      • getOmaInfo

        @GetMapping(value="/oma/info")
public String getOmaInfo(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                        org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)

        User info handler for authenticated users shows user information that is provided by the authenticative proxy in front of the application.

        Details are fetched from user's authentication object by the view.

        Application assumes that the application path 'oma' is protected by the authenticative proxy and user details are released on this path. It is up to the proxy to protect the application

        Parameters:
        model - Model object for the view. Only authentication status (which is assumed to be tru on this path of the application) and the ip address of the user are passed in the model.
        req - HttpServletRequest object is used to pass the user ip address to the Model.
        auth - Authentication object is used to figure out if the user has the superAdmin role. If (s)he has, more details are showed on the view.
        Returns:
        All handlers return a handle to the same view.
        See Also:
        ReqAuthFilter

      • postInfo

        @PostMapping(value="/info")
public String postInfo(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                   @RequestParam(value="userStr")
                                                   String userStr,
                                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        PostMapping to save userStr to the Session object. Implemented only for curiosity. This functionality is not actually needed to demonstrate request token authentication.
        Parameters:
        userStr - User provided string to be saved.
        session - The user provided string is saved in the Session object.

      • postOmaInfo

        @PostMapping(value="/oma/info")

                                                          String userStr,
